Hello! ğŸ‘‹  
Iâ€™m happy to help you with the admission process at Marwadi University. Below is a general guide that should cover most of what you need to know. If you have any specific questionsâ€”like programâ€‘specific requirements or deadlinesâ€”just let me know!

---

## 1ï¸âƒ£ Check Eligibility

| Program | Typical Eligibility |
|---------|---------------------|
| **Undergraduate (UG)** | 10+2 (or equivalent) with a minimum percentage (often 50% for general, 45% for SC/ST/OBC). |
| **Postgraduate (PG)** | Bachelorâ€™s degree in a related field with a minimum percentage (usually 55%â€“60%). |
| **Diploma / Certificate** | 10+2 or equivalent; some courses may have additional criteria. |
| **Research (M.Phil./Ph.D.)** | Masterâ€™s degree (or equivalent) with a minimum GPA/percentage. |

> **Tip:** Always verify the exact cutâ€‘off marks or GPA on the universityâ€™s official website or in the admission brochure for the specific course youâ€™re interested in.

---

## 2ï¸âƒ£ Gather Required Documents

| Document | Typical Use |
|----------|-------------|
| **Application Form** | Completed online or hard copy. |
| **Mark Sheets** | 10+2, Bachelorâ€™s, Masterâ€™s (as applicable). |
| **Degree Certificate** | Original + photocopies. |
| **Passportâ€‘size Photographs** | Usually 2â€“4 recent photos. |
| **Identity Proof** | Aadhar card, PAN card, or passport. |
| **Entrance Exam Score** | If the program requires an entrance test (e.g., JEE, NEET, GATE, etc.). |
| **Letter of Recommendation** | For certain PG or research programs. |
| **Statement of Purpose** | For research or certain PG courses. |
| **Fee Receipt** | Proof of payment of application fee. |

> **Pro tip:** Keep both originals and photocopies handy, and doubleâ€‘check that all documents are in the required format (e.g., PDF, JPEG, etc.).

---

## 3ï¸âƒ£ Apply Online (Preferred Method)

1. **Visit the Official Site**  
   ğŸ‘‰ https://www.marwadiuniversity.edu.in/  
   (Look for the â€œAdmissionsâ€ or â€œApply Nowâ€ section.)

2. **Create an Account**

3. **Fill the Application Form**  
   - Choose your program and branch.  
   - Enter personal details, academic history, and upload documents.

4. **Pay the Application Fee**

   - Keep the payment receipt; youâ€™ll need it for verification.

5. **Submit**  
   Once youâ€™re satisfied with the information, submit the form. Youâ€™ll receive a confirmation email

## 1ï¸âƒ£ Know the Eligibility

|---------|---------------------|

## 2ï¸âƒ£ Prepare Your Documents

| Document | Why Itâ€™s Needed |

| **Application Form** | Completed online or hard copy. |

| **Letter of Recommendation** | For certain PG or research programs. |
| **Statement of Purpose** | For research or some PG courses. |
| **Fee Receipt** | Proof of payment of application fee. |

> **Pro tip:** Keep both originals and photocopies ready, and doubleâ€‘check that all files are in the required format (PDF, JPEG, etc.).

---

## 3ï¸âƒ£ Apply Online (Recommended)

1. **Go to the Official Site**  
   ğŸ‘‰ https://www.marwadiuniversity.edu.in/  
   Look for the â€œAdmissionsâ€ or â€œApply Nowâ€ section.

2. **Create an Account**  
   Register with your email and a secure password.

3. **Fill Out the Application Form**  
   - Select your program and branch.  
   - Enter personal details, academic history, and upload the required documents.

4. **Pay the Application Fee**  
   - Payment options: credit/debit card, net banking, UPI, etc.

5. **Submit**

## 4ï¸âƒ£ After Submission

| **Document Verification** | Submit original documents for verification (usually in person or via courier). |

## 5ï¸âƒ£ Common Questions

| Question | Quick Answer |

| **Is there a fee waiver?** | Some categories (SC/ST/OBC, economically weaker sections) may qualify. Check the fee waiver section. |
| **How long does the process take?** | Typically 4â€“6 weeks from application to admission offer, but it can vary. |

---

### Need More Help?

- **Specific program details?**  
- **Entrance exam dates?**  
- **Fee waiver eligibility?**  

Just let me know, and Iâ€™ll provide the exact information you need!

how to order in zomato

Hey there! ğŸ‘‹ Ordering food on Zomato is super easy. Hereâ€™s a quick stepâ€‘byâ€‘step guide to help you get your favorite meals delivered right to your doorstep:

---

## 1ï¸âƒ£ Get the App (or Use the Web)

| Option | How to Access |
|--------|---------------|
| **Mobile App** | Download from the App Store (iOS) or Google Play (Android). |
| **Website** | Visit https://www.zomato.com/ and sign in or create an account. |

---

## 2ï¸âƒ£ Sign In / Create an Account

1. **Open the app or website.**  
2. Tap **â€œSign Inâ€** (or â€œCreate Accountâ€).  
3. You can register with:
   - Email address
   - Phone number
   - Google, Facebook, or Apple ID (if youâ€™re on iOS)

> **Tip:** If you already have an account, just log in. If not, the signâ€‘up process takes less than a minute.

---

## 3ï¸âƒ£ Set Your Delivery Location

1. In the search bar, type your **address** or let the app use your GPS location.  
2. Zomato will show restaurants that deliver to that area.

---

## 4ï¸âƒ£ Browse Restaurants & Menu

1. **Explore** categories (e.g., â€œPizza,â€ â€œBiryani,â€ â€œDessertsâ€) or use the search bar for a specific dish.  
2. Tap a restaurant to see its menu, ratings, and reviews.  
3. **Add items** to your cart by tapping the â€œAddâ€ button next to each dish.  
4. You can adjust quantities, add special instructions, or choose sides.

---

## 5ï¸âƒ£ Review Your Cart

1. Tap the cart icon (usually at the top right).  
2. Doubleâ€‘check items, quantities, and any special notes.  
3. If youâ€™re happy, tap **â€œProceed to Checkout.â€**

---

## 6ï¸âƒ£ Checkout & Payment

1. **Delivery Address** â€“ Confirm or edit your address.  
2. **Payment Method** â€“ Choose from:
   - Credit/Debit Card
   - Net Banking
   - UPI
   - Cash on Delivery (if available in your area)
   - Zomato Wallet (if you have one)

3. **Apply Promo Codes** â€“ If you have a discount code, enter it here.  
4. **Place Order** â€“ Tap **â€œPlace Orderâ€**. Youâ€™ll receive a confirmation screen with an order number.

---

## 7ï¸âƒ£ Track Your Order

- In the app, go to **â€œOrdersâ€** â†’ **â€œActive Orders.â€**  
- Youâ€™ll see realâ€‘time updates: â€œPreparing,â€ â€œOut for delivery,â€ etc.  
- The delivery personâ€™s contact info is usually available if you need to call or message them.

---

## 8ï¸âƒ£ After Delivery

- Rate the food and the delivery experience.  
- If thereâ€™s an issue (wrong order, late delivery, etc.), tap **â€œHelpâ€** or **â€œReport a Problemâ€** in the order details.

---

### Quick FAQ

| Question | Answer |
|----------|--------|
| **Can I cancel an order?** | Yes, but only before the restaurant starts preparing. Tap â€œCancelâ€ in the order details. |
| **Is there a delivery fee?** | It varies by restaurant and distance. Some restaurants offer free delivery for orders above a certain amount. |
| **How do I tip?** | You can add a tip during checkout or after the order is delivered. |

---

Thatâ€™s it! ğŸ‰ Now youâ€™re ready to enjoy delicious food from the comfort of your home. If you run into any hiccups or have more questions, just let me know. Happy eating!

## 5ï¸âƒ£ Review Your Cart

1. Tap the cart icon (usually at the top right).  
2. Check each item, adjust quantities, or remove anything you donâ€™t want.

## 6ï¸âƒ£ Checkout & Payment

2. **Payment Method** â€“ Choose from:
   - Credit/Debit Card
   - Net Banking
   - UPI
   - Flipkart Pay Later (if eligible)
   - Cash on Delivery (COD) â€“ available in many regions

3. **Apply Promo Codes** â€“ If you have a discount code, enter it in the â€œApply Couponâ€ field.  
4. **Place Order** â€“ Tap **â€œPlace Order.â€** Youâ€™ll receive an order confirmation with a tracking number.

---

## 7ï¸âƒ£ Track Your Order

- Go to **â€œMy Ordersâ€** â†’ **â€œActive Orders.â€**  
- Flipkart provides realâ€‘time updates: â€œOrder Placed,â€ â€œShipped,â€ â€œOut for Delivery,â€ etc.

## 8ï¸âƒ£ After Delivery

### Quick FAQ

| Question | Answer |
|----------|--------|

| **Is there a delivery fee?** | Delivery charges vary by seller and distance. Some sellers offer free delivery for orders above a certain amount. |
| **What if I want to change the delivery address?** | You can edit the address before the order is shipped. Once itâ€™s out for delivery, youâ€™ll need to contact Flipkart support. |
| **How do I use Flipkart Pay Later?** | Add the product to your cart, choose â€œFlipkart Pay Laterâ€ at checkout, and follow the onâ€‘screen steps. |

---

Thatâ€™s all there is to it! ğŸ‰ Now youâ€™re ready to shop Flipkart like a champ. If you run into any hiccups or have more questions, just let me knowâ€”happy shopping!
to cancel order on Flipkart

Hey there! ğŸ‘‹  
Cancelling a Flipkart order is quick and easyâ€”just follow these steps:

---

## 1ï¸âƒ£ Open the Flipkart App or Website

- **App:** Launch the Flipkart app on your phone.  
- **Website:** Go to https://www.flipkart.com/ and log in.

---

## 2ï¸âƒ£ Go to â€œMy Ordersâ€

- Tap the **â€œAccountâ€** icon (bottom right on the app) or click **â€œMy Ordersâ€** in the menu on the website.

---

## 3ï¸âƒ£ Find the Order You Want to Cancel

- Scroll through your recent orders or use the search bar to locate the specific order.

---

## 4ï¸âƒ£ Check the Order Status

- **Can Cancel?**  
  - If the status shows **â€œOrder Placedâ€** or **â€œProcessingâ€**, you can cancel.  
  - If itâ€™s already **â€œShippedâ€** or **â€œOut for Delivery,â€** cancellation isnâ€™t possible; youâ€™ll need to initiate a return instead.

---

## 5ï¸âƒ£ Cancel the Order

- **App:**  
  1. Tap the order.  
  2. Tap **â€œCancel Order.â€**  
  3. Choose a reason from the dropdown (optional).  
  4. Confirm the cancellation.

- **Website:**  
  1. Click the order.  
  2. Click **â€œCancel Order.â€**  
  3. Select a reason (optional).  
  4. Confirm.

---

## 6ï¸âƒ£ Confirmation & Refund

- Youâ€™ll receive an email/SMS confirming the cancellation.  
- The refund will be processed to your original payment method within 3â€“5 business days (depending on the payment gateway).

---

## 7ï¸âƒ£ If You Canâ€™t Cancel

- **Order already shipped:**  
  - Go to **â€œReturn/Exchangeâ€** in the order details.  
  - Follow the return instructions to get a refund after the item is returned.

- **Need help:**  
  - Tap **â€œHelpâ€** â†’ **â€œContact Usâ€** in the app or visit Flipkartâ€™s help center: https://www.flipkart.com/help-center.  
  - You can also call Flipkart customer support at **1800â€‘11â€‘2211** (India) or use the chat option.

---

### Quick Tips

| Tip | Why It Helps |
|-----|--------------|
| **Act fast** | Cancellation is only possible before the order is shipped. |
| **Keep the order ID handy** | Makes it easier for support to locate your order. |
| **Check the return window** | If youâ€™re returning a shipped item, you usually have 30 days from delivery. |

---

Thatâ€™s it! ğŸ‰ If you hit any snags or have more questions, just let me knowâ€”Iâ€™m here to help. Happy shopping!

Hello! ğŸ‘‹ Letâ€™s dive into what a 10thâ€‘standard (Stdâ€‘10) studentâ€™s world looks likeâ€”curriculum, exams, study habits, and a few tips to help them shine. Whether youâ€™re a student, parent, or teacher, this overview should give you a clear picture. --- ## 1ï¸âƒ£ Whatâ€™s the 10thâ€‘Standard Journey All About? | Aspect | What It Means | |--------|---------------| | **Age Range** | Typically 15â€“16 years old (sometimes 14â€“17, depending on the school system). | | **Academic Milestone** | Marks the â€œmiddleâ€ of secondary education. In many countries, itâ€™s the last year of â€œsecondaryâ€ before â€œhigher secondaryâ€ (11thâ€“12th). | | **Key Exams** | â€¢ **State Board / CBSE / ICSE** (India)
â€¢ **SAT/ACT** (USA) for college prep
â€¢ **GCSE** (UK)
â€¢ **Oâ€‘Levels** (Commonwealth) | | **Purpose** | â€¢ Assess foundational knowledge.
â€¢ Provide a baseline for future specialization (science, commerce, arts).
â€¢ Often a â€œgatewayâ€ to higher secondary streams. | --- ## 2ï¸âƒ£ Typical Curriculum (Indiaâ€‘Style Example) | Subject | Core Topics (Typical) | Why It Matters | |---------|-----------------------|----------------| | **Mathematics** | Algebra, Geometry, Trigonometry, Statistics, Basic Calculus | Builds problemâ€‘solving and logical reasoning skills. | | **Science** | Physics (Mechanics, Electricity), Chemistry (Basic Concepts), Biology (Human Body, Ecology) | Introduces scientific method and realâ€‘world applications. | | **Social Science** | History (Indian & World), Geography (Physical & Human), Civics, Economics | Develops critical thinking about society and governance. | | **Languages** | Mother tongue (Hindi, Tamil, etc.), English, Second language (if applicable) | Enhances communication, reading comprehension, and cultural awareness. | | **Computer Science / IT** | Basics of programming, Internet, Digital Literacy | Prepares students for a techâ€‘driven world. | | **Physical Education / Arts** | Sports, Music, Visual Arts | Encourages holistic development. | > **Note:** The exact subjects and depth vary by board (CBSE, ICSE, State Boards) and school (public vs. private). --- ## 3ï¸âƒ£ Exam Pattern & Assessment | Exam | Format | Weightage | |------|--------|-----------| | **Board Exam** | Paperâ€‘based (multiple choice, short answer, long answer) | 70â€“80% of final grade | | **Class Test / Internal Assessment** | Periodic tests, projects, assignments | 20â€“30% | | **Practicals** | Lab work, fieldwork | 10â€“15% (especially in science) | - **Marking Scheme**: Usually +3 for correct, -1 for wrong (CBSE), or +4/-1 (ICSE). - **Result Impact**: Scores determine eligibility for higher secondary streams and scholarships. --- ## 4ï¸âƒ£ Study Tips for 10thâ€‘Standard Students | Tip | How to Apply | |-----|--------------| | **Create a Study Schedule** | Allocate 1â€“2 hours per subject daily; use a planner or digital calendar. | | **Active Recall** | After reading, close the book and recite key points. | | **Practice Past Papers** | Familiarize with exam patterns and time management. | | **Group Study** | Discuss difficult topics with peers; teaching others reinforces learning. | | **Balanced Breaks** | 5â€“10 minute breaks every 45â€“50 minutes to avoid burnout. | | **Healthy Lifestyle** | Adequate sleep (8â€“9 hrs), nutritious meals, and regular exercise. | | **Seek Help Early** | Donâ€™t wait until the last minute to ask teachers or tutors about doubts. | --- ## 5ï¸âƒ£ Common Challenges & How to Overcome Them | Challenge | Quick Fix | |-----------|-----------| | **Time Management** | Use a â€œPomodoroâ€ timer (25â€‘min focus + 5â€‘min break). | | **Procrastination** | Set microâ€‘goals (e.g., â€œFinish 5 math problemsâ€). | | **Exam Anxiety** | Practice deep breathing, visualize success, and keep a â€œstressâ€‘reliefâ€ routine (music, short walks). | | **Balancing Extracurriculars** | Prioritize tasks; allocate fixed slots for sports or clubs. | --- ## 6ï¸âƒ£ Beyond the Classroom: Building a Strong Foundation | Area | Why Itâ€™s Important | |------|--------------------| | **Critical Thinking** | Helps analyze problems beyond rote answers. | | **Communication Skills** | Writing essays, presentations, and debates boost confidence. | | **Digital Literacy** | Knowing how to research online, use spreadsheets, and code basics is increasingly valuable. | | **Selfâ€‘Reflection** | Journaling or reflecting on learning helps identify strengths and areas for growth. | --- ## 7ï¸âƒ£ Quick Resources | Resource | What It Offers | |----------|----------------| | **CBSE/ICSE Official Sites** | Past papers, syllabus, exam dates. | | **Khan Academy** | Free video lessons for math, science, and more. | | **Quizlet** | Flashcards for quick revision. | | **Google Classroom / Microsoft Teams** | Classroom collaboration tools. | | **YouTube Channels** | *Khan Academy*, *CrashCourse*, *Unacademy* (India). | --- ### Final Thought The 10th grade is a pivotal yearâ€”think of it as the â€œlaunchpadâ€ for future academic and career paths. With a solid study routine, balanced lifestyle, and a curious mindset, students can not only ace their exams but also develop lifelong learning habits. If youâ€™d like deeper insights into a specific subject, exam strategy, or study plan, just let me know! Happy learning!

paper style

**How to Format a Gujarati Academic Paper (Paperâ€¯Style Guide)**  
*(Use this template for essays, research reports, or class assignments in Gujarati.)*

---

## 1.â€¯General Layout

| Element | Typical Specification | Why It Matters |
|---------|-----------------------|----------------|
| **Paper Size** | A4 (210â€¯Ã—â€¯297â€¯mm) | Standard for printing & digital sharing. |
| **Margins** | Topâ€¯=â€¯2â€¯cm, Bottomâ€¯=â€¯2â€¯cm, Leftâ€¯=â€¯2.5â€¯cm, Rightâ€¯=â€¯2â€¯cm | Keeps text readable and leaves space for binding. |
| **Font** | *Mangal* (for Gujarati) or *Devanagari* (if using Hindi script) | Clear, legible, and widely supported. |
| **Font Size** | Bodyâ€¯=â€¯12â€¯pt, Headingsâ€¯=â€¯14â€“16â€¯pt (bold) | Ensures readability; headings stand out. |
| **Line Spacing** | 1.5â€¯Ã—â€¯line spacing | Gives room for comments & makes the paper look clean. |
| **Page Numbers** | Bottomâ€‘center or bottomâ€‘right | Helps reviewers locate sections. |
| **Header** | Title of paper (short) or author name (optional) | Adds a professional touch. |
| **Footer** | Page number + optional copyright | Keeps the document tidy. |

---

## 2.â€¯Paper Structure (Typical Sections)

| Section | Purpose | Typical Length | Formatting Notes |
|---------|---------|----------------|------------------|
| **Title Page** | Title, author, institution, date | 1 page | Centered title (bold, 16â€¯pt). Author name, department, university, date below. |
| **Abstract** | Brief summary (150â€“250â€¯words) | 1 paragraph | Gujarati abstract; use *Abstract* heading (bold). |
| **Keywords** | 3â€“5 key terms | 1 line | After abstract, italicized or in parentheses. |
| **Introduction** | Context, problem statement, objectives | 1â€“2â€¯pages | Use heading â€œàªªàª°àª¿àªšàª¯â€ (bold). |
| **Literature Review / Background** | Existing research, theories | 1â€“2â€¯pages | Heading â€œàª¸àª¾àª¹àª¿àª¤à«àª¯ àª¸àª®à«€àª•à«àª·àª¾â€ or â€œàªªà«ƒàª·à«àª àª­à«‚àª®àª¿â€. |
| **Methodology** | How you gathered data | 1â€“2â€¯pages | Heading â€œàªªàª¦à«àª§àª¤àª¿àª¶àª¾àª¸à«àª¤à«àª°â€. |
| **Results / Findings** | Data, observations | 1â€“3â€¯pages | Heading â€œàªªàª°àª¿àª£àª¾àª®à«‹â€. Use tables/figures if needed. |
| **Discussion** | Interpretation of results | 1â€“2â€¯pages | Heading â€œàªšàª°à«àªšàª¾â€. |
| **Conclusion** | Summary, implications, future work | Â½â€“1â€¯page | Heading â€œàª¨àª¿àª·à«àª•àª°à«àª·â€. |
| **References** | All cited works | 1â€“2â€¯pages | Use Gujarati citation style (e.g., APA in Gujarati). |
| **Appendices** | Supplementary material | Optional | Label as â€œàªªàª°àª¿àª¶àª¿àª·à«àªŸâ€ and number. |

---

## 3.â€¯Headings & Subâ€‘Headings

| Level | Style | Example |
|-------|-------|---------|
| **H1** | Bold, 16â€¯pt, centered | **àªªàª°àª¿àªšàª¯** |
| **H2** | Bold, 14â€¯pt, leftâ€‘aligned | **àª¸àª¾àª¹àª¿àª¤à«àª¯ àª¸àª®à«€àª•à«àª·àª¾** |
| **H3** | Italic, 12â€¯pt, leftâ€‘aligned | *àªªàª¦à«àª§àª¤àª¿àª¶àª¾àª¸à«àª¤à«àª°* |
| **H4** | Regular, 12â€¯pt, leftâ€‘aligned | *àª¡à«‡àªŸàª¾ àª¸àª‚àª—à«àª°àª¹* |

*Tip:* Keep heading hierarchy consistent; use Roman numerals or Arabic numbers if you prefer numbered sections (e.g., 1.â€¯àªªàª°àª¿àªšàª¯, 1.1â€¯àª¸àª¾àª¹àª¿àª¤à«àª¯ àª¸àª®à«€àª•à«àª·àª¾).

---

## 4.â€¯Tables & Figures

| Element | Placement | Caption Style |
|---------|-----------|---------------|
| **Table** | Below the heading, centered | â€œàªŸà«‡àª¬àª²â€¯1.â€¯àª¡à«‡àªŸàª¾ àª¸àª¾àª°àª¾àª‚àª¶â€ |
| **Figure** | Below the heading, centered | â€œàª†àª•à«ƒàª¤àª¿â€¯1.â€¯àª—à«àª°àª¾àª«àª¿àª•àª² àªªà«àª°àª¸à«àª¤à«àª¤àª¿â€ |
| **Numbering** | Sequential (Tableâ€¯1, Tableâ€¯2, â€¦) | Use Arabic numerals. |
| **Source** | Below the table/figure | â€œàª¸à«àª¤à«àª°à«‹àª¤: àªªà«‹àª¤àª¾àª¨à«àª‚ àª¡à«‡àªŸàª¾â€ |

---

## 5.â€¯Citation & References (Gujarati APA Style)

| Element | Format (Gujarati) | Example |
|---------|-------------------|---------|
| **Book** | àª²à«‡àª–àª•àª¨à«àª‚ àª¨àª¾àª®. (àªµàª°à«àª·). *àªªà«àª¸à«àª¤àª•àª¨à«àª‚ àª¶à«€àª°à«àª·àª•*. àªªà«àª°àª•àª¾àª¶àª•. | àªªàªŸà«‡àª²,â€¯àªœ.â€¯(2020). *àª—à«àªœàª°àª¾àª¤à«€ àª­àª¾àª·àª¾*. àªªà«àª°àª•àª¾àª¶àª¨â€¯àªªà«àª°àª•àª¾àª¶àª¨. |
| **Journal Article** | àª²à«‡àª–àª•àª¨à«àª‚ àª¨àª¾àª®. (àªµàª°à«àª·). àª²à«‡àª–àª¨à«àª‚ àª¶à«€àª°à«àª·àª•. *àªœàª°à«àª¨àª²àª¨à«àª‚ àª¨àª¾àª®*,â€¯àªµà«‹àª²à«àª¯à«àª®(àª‡àª¶à«àª¯à«), àªªà«ƒàª·à«àª . | àª¶àª¾àª¹,â€¯àª.â€¯(2019). àª­àª¾àª·àª¾ àªµàª¿àª•àª¾àª¸. *àª—à«àªœàª°àª¾àª¤à«€ àªœàª°à«àª¨àª²*,â€¯12(3),â€¯45â€‘60. |
| **Website** | àª²à«‡àª–àª•àª¨à«àª‚ àª¨àª¾àª®. (àªµàª°à«àª·). àª¶à«€àª°à«àª·àª•. *àªµà«‡àª¬àª¸àª¾àª‡àªŸ*. URL | àª¨àª°à«àª®àª¦àª¾,â€¯àª¸.â€¯(2021). àª—à«àªœàª°àª¾àª¤à«€ àªµà«àª¯àª¾àª•àª°àª£. *àª—à«àªœàª°àª¾àª¤à«€ àª­àª¾àª·àª¾ àªµà«‡àª¬àª¸àª¾àª‡àªŸ*. https://gujarati.org/grammar |

*Tip:* Keep all references in alphabetical order by the authorâ€™s surname.

## 6.â€¯Common Formatting Checklist

- [ ] **Margins** set to 2â€¯cm (left) and 2.5â€¯cm (right).  
- [ ] **Font**: Mangal, 12â€¯pt for body text.  
- [ ] **Line spacing**: 1.5â€¯Ã—â€¯line.  
- [ ] **Page numbers**: Bottomâ€‘center.  
- [ ] **Headings**: Consistent hierarchy.  
- [ ] **Tables/Figures**: Captioned and numbered.  
- [ ] **References**: Complete and correctly formatted.  
- [ ] **Spelling & Grammar**: Proofread in Gujarati.
